title: Colors - ISCC/NBS

metadata.description: Learn about Colors - ISCC/NBS with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
ISCC-NBS is a system for color names based on a set of 12 color terms and a small set of 
adjectives.
It was first established by ISCC (Inter-Society Color Council) in the 1930s by 
delegates from American trade organizations and the National Bureau of Standards.
"To be a means of designating colors in the United 
States Pharmacopoeia, in the National Formulary, and in general literature ... 
 to be standardized as to be acceptable and usable 
by science, sufficiently broad to be appreciated and used by science, art, and 
industry, and sufficiently commonplace to be understood, at least in a general 
way, by the whole public."

practice_exercises.description: Create an example that applies the concepts from this tutorial.

related_topics.title: C Common Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them

quiz.question: What is NBS?
options:
a system for color names based on a set of 12 color terms and a small set of 
adjectives

of designating colors in the United 
States Pharmacopoeia
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of NBS is 'a system for color names based on a set of 12 color terms and a small set of 
adjectives'.

quiz.question: What is To be a?
options:
of designating colors in the United 
States Pharmacopoeia

a system for color names based on a set of 12 color terms and a small set of 
adjectives
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of To be a is 'of designating colors in the United 
States Pharmacopoeia'.

summary: This tutorial covers Colors - ISCC/NBS concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Colors - ISCC/NBS effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Colors - ISCC/NBS and how to apply it in your projects.
